alert.note: Alert for Southern San Luis Valley; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 4:38PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Costilla County through 515 PM MDT... At 437 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fort Garland, or 16 miles southwest of Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Costilla county, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blanca and Fort Garland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Southern San Luis Valley; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft
